author: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
synopsis: A classic novel exploring themes of love, class, and societal expectations in 19th century England.

author: George Orwell
synopsis: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and propaganda to control its citizens.

author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
synopsis: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following a young wizard's adventures at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

author: Mark Twain
title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
synopsis: A novel about a young boy's adventures in the American South, exploring themes of freedom and childhood.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Hobbit
synopsis: A fantasy novel about the quest of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who helps a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland from a dragon.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The Great Gatsby
synopsis: A novel set in the Jazz Age that critiques the American Dream through the mysterious and wealthy Jay Gatsby.

author: Harper Lee
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
synopsis: A novel exploring racial injustice and moral growth in the American South through the eyes of a young girl.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
synopsis: A landmark of magical realism, this novel follows the Buendía family over several generations in the fictional town of Macondo.

author: Agatha Christie
title: Murder on the Orient Express
synopsis: A mystery novel featuring detective Hercule Poirot, who investigates a murder aboard the luxurious Orient Express train.

author: J.D. Salinger
title: The Catcher in the Rye
synopsis: A novel about the teenage angst and alienation of Holden Caulfield as he navigates life in New York City.
